title: How to edit and delete a user
content:
Edit a user

  1. From the main menu, click Users.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit. See the User details section below. The General tab is displayed by default.
  4. Save your changes.

User details

  • General tab

    Field Description
    Login name Login name of the user.

    If the DB user login identifier field is set to Email for this account, you don't need to set the Login name field.
    ID User ID.
    Customer UID

    Displays customer UID got from external user repositories such as LDAP, SAML IdP, OAuth IdP, or other stores.

    Applicable to users with LDAP or Federation authentication type only.
    First name First name of the user.
    Last name Last name of the user.
    Middle name Middle name of the user.
    Full name

    Full name of the user.
    Email Email of the user.

    If the DB user login identifier field is set to Email for this account, the email must be unique for users (including all authentication types) in this account. The value of this field can be modified to support user login by using their latest email.
    If you see the email is "<username>@dummy.com" for an LDAP/SAML/OAuth user, possibly the user's actual email has not been synchronized to Suite Administration yet, or you have LDAP/SAML/OAuth users with the same email. Check your system log for more information.
    Authentication type For information about modifying user authentication type, see the Authentication type section.
    Account Parent account.
    Role

    User role.
    User type

    User type.
    Language

    User language.
    Home phone number Home phone number of the user.
    Office phone number

    Office phone number of the user.

    Mobile phone number

    Mobile phone number of the user.
    Zip code Zip code of the user.
    External ID External ID of the user.
    Description The description that captures the details of the user.
    Creation time

    The time that the user was created.
    Last modified time The time that the user was modified.

  • Tenants tab

    This tab displays the tenants this user can access.

    For more information on tenants, see Tenants.

User status

  • For the users with LDAP, SAML, or OAuth authentication type, the status is read-only.
  • For the users with DB authentication type, you can change the user status manually.
Status Description
Inactive For users created via user interface, the user status is Inactive after the user record is created. Inactive users can't log in to Service Management Automation.
Active The user status becomes Active automatically when the user changes the password.

Reset password

If users request you to reset their password, you can click Reset password on the toolbar in the Edit user page. The users then receive an email with instructions on how to reset their password.

You can only reset password for users with DB authentication type.

Alternatively, you can use the Reset password business rule template in Studio or on the Task plan tab of a record to automatically send the user an email with instructions on how to reset the password.

Change authentication type

Authentication type of an account user can be changed after the user is created.

  1. From the main menu, click Users.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  3. Click Change authentication type on the toolbar.
  4. In Change to drop-down list, select an authentication type:
    • DB: Users use the suite credentials to log in to Service Management Automation.
    • LDAP: Users use the credentials stored in LDAP servers to log in to Service Management Automation.
    • SAML: Users use the credentials stored in federated IdPs (SAML) to log in to Service Management Automation.
    • OAUTH: Users use the credentials stored in federated IdPs (OAuth) to log in to Service Management Automation.
  5. Click Change.

You can also change the authentication type for multiple users simultaneously by selecting the check box next to each user in the grid.

  • Users are required to set password after the authentication type is changed to DB.
  • After the authentication type is changed to LDAP, SAML, or OAUTH, the system displays the user's authentication type as LDAP/SAML/OAUTH. The user needs to use the credential in LDAP server or federated IdP to log in to Service Management Automation, previous password is invalid.

Lock or unlock user

The suite administrator can lock or unlock users.

To do this, follow these steps:

  1. From the main menu, click Users.
  2. Click the user in the ID column to display the selected user.
  3. Click Lock user or Unlock user on the toolbar to lock or unlock the user as needed.
  • When a user enters an incorrect password over 5 times during login, the system locks the user.
  • The locked user can't log in to authorized Service Management Automation applications.
  • Profile of the locked user isn't synced to suite applications.
  • The Lock user or Unlock user button changes the user status only in the Service Management Automation applications. It doesn't change the user status in the LDAP, SAML, or OAuth server.

Alternatively, you can use the Lock user and Unlock user business rule templates in Studio or on the Task plan tab of a record to automatically lock or unlock a user.

Delete a user

When you delete a user in Suite Administration, the deletion is synced to the tenant by a synchronization job that runs every 2 hours or by a manual synchronization triggered by the tenant admin in a Service Management tenant. If you need to create another user with the same login name as the deleted user, wait after the deletion is synced to the tenant.​​​​​

  • The users who are specified as tenant admin can't be deleted.
  • If you want to delete a user with the LDAP, SAML, or OAuth authentication type, first delete the user in the LDAP server or the external IdP before deleting it from the Suite Administration. Otherwise, the user will be synchronized back from the LDAP server or the external IdP.
  • Once a user is deleted in Suite Administration, the user will become a contact in the tenant after two hours at most. Then, the related licenses can be re-assigned to other users three days later. Do not delete the contact within three days, or the license will not be released.
